intro: Tarenna brachysiphon, commonly known as the narrow-leaf tarenna, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It produces small, elliptical fruits that contain a single seed. Tarenna brachysiphon is often found in moist, shaded habitats within the rainforest understory.
